result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SIGNATURE BOND:  Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1,500.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

-I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call Justice Support Center at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:16 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Christopher Ray Gates in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Christopher Ray Gates.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF136 (RW), 21CF647 (RW), 22CF9 (RW), & 22CF132 (RW/INIT).  DE does qualify for PD. Court QUASHES WARRANT. Atty Dofli believes Atty Firkus represents him on a Polk County matter, PD's office to reach out to Atty Firkus to see if he'll take these files.  As to 22CF132- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE updates address on file.  DE still has pending matters in Polk County. Court notes of the 4 SCC cases, PH needs to be held on 3 of the 4 files.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond. Adjourned at 1:24 PM. bph
